intro: Microstylis protracta var. brevidens, commonly known as the short-styled protracta, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, characterized by its unique inflorescence structure consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color, with a short, narrow spadix that distinguishes it from other varieties. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests and requires careful cultivation due to its specific ecological needs. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a subject of study in plant taxonomy and conservation efforts.
